intro: Lasiocroton, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. They typically grow as shrubs or small trees, with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Lasiocroton species are often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
